intro: Palmervandenbroekia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan palmervandenbroekia, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are typically white or pale yellow, emitting a mild fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
